main event: On April 11, 1957, a weather observer in South Dakota witnessed a stream of small white objects, spherical in shape, covering an arc of about 25-30 degrees. The objects flashed from white to pink, contracted to spherical shape, and then disappeared from view in about 10 minutes. This sighting exhibited unusual motion but had insufficient data for evaluation.
interesting points: The sighting occurred in South Dakota and was observed by a weather observer, adding credibility to the report.
The objects had erratic and aimless movement before disappearing from view, indicating unusual behavior.
The objects appeared spherical, flashed from white to pink, and then contracted to spherical shape before disappearing, suggesting unconventional characteristics.
The report mentions that the weather was fair during the observation, ruling out weather-related phenomena.
The report notes that there were 4-5 objects observed, covering a significant area of the sky.
sighted object: stream of small white spherical objects
location: 3 miles west of Piedmont, South Dakota
